content_parts.title: Duplication enhancements

content_parts.content:
Duplication functionality is improved to help you save time, enhancements include:

  • A new dialog box to simplify entering or updating required values for duplication.
  • No limits on the number of lines that can be duplicated.

content_parts.title: Authorizations for manufacturing, stock, and finance

content_parts.content:
User rights management is enhanced and simplified to improve accuracy and reduce implementation and maintenance time.

The manufacturing, stock, and finance authorization processes include the following improvements:

  • Reviewed permission texts to ensure a better understanding
  • Grouping of permissions for a simplified setup
  • Automatic reference lookup management
  • Standard roles update
  • Display only the menu items that correspond to the user's rights

content_parts.title: Bulk delete not available for Customer, Supplier, and Routing pages

content_parts.content: You can use the bulk delete option on Business entity, Customer, Supplier, and Routing pages.

content_parts.title: Supplier contact updates incorrectly change the Print As value in Sage Intacct on synchronization

content_parts.content:
Supplier updates do not change the "Print As" name in Sage Intacct after synchronization.
You can edit the "Print As" field in the Sage Intacct Business entity address mapping.

content_parts.title: Notification history: The link to a stock adjustment document does not work

content_parts.title: Purchase order planning: Group MRP suggestions to create purchase orders

content_parts.content: To improve stock reordering, supply order planning is introduced. Use the Purchase order planning page to group purchase suggestions together to reduce the number of purchase orders to generate from MRP suggestions.

content_parts.title: Sales orders: Displays partially shipped when transaction is fully shipped

content_parts.content: The sales order status updates correctly when a sales order line or lines are deleted from the order after a shipment has been partially created.

content_parts.title: Purchase order report amounts are missing commas

content_parts.title: Expired lot cannot be issued

content_parts.title: Items page: Sales unit defined on the Customer tab cannot be used in a price list

content_parts.title: Stock valuation: Calculation user displays incorrectly

content_parts.title: Stock allocation: Shipping does not release allocations correctly

content_parts.title: Purchase receipt lines with unsuccessful post to stock or tax calculation shoud not be available on purchase invoice

content_parts.content: When a purchase receipt in error is invoiced, the status does not change to invoiced until the error is resolved.

content_parts.title: Default dimensions on Work order and Purchase order from Sales order

content_parts.content: Stored attributes and dimensions can now be inherited from the Sale order line to the Work order released item, components, and operation resources (make-to-order) respectively to the Purchase order line (buy-to-order). In addition, the dimension dialog box on the Work order released item now provides the option to update the dimensions and attributes of the associated Work order components and operation resources.

content_parts.title: Intacct integration - Employee dimension integration (Default of dimension)

content_parts.content: You can now designate dimensions and attributes as a default in the tab 'Financials' of the 'Customer' page and automatically assign them in sales documents (sales order and direct sales invoice lines).

content_parts.title: Intacct integration - Employee dimension integration (Manual entry of dimension)

content_parts.content: It is now possible to activate the 'Employee' attribute type and subsequently assign an 'Employee' to an SDMO transaction in the manner of a dimension. If the Sage Intacct integration is enabled, a smart event in Sage Intacct ensures that each creation, update, and deletion of 'Employees' in Sage Intacct is reflected in SDMO.

content_parts.title: Work in Progress (WIP) balancing inquiry enhancements

content_parts.content:
The "Work in Progress (WIP)" balance now displays for each work order and the "Work in Progress" total for the "As of date" now displays in the Work in progress inquiry. The total is not impacted if work orders are filtered in results grid. 

For Average and FIFO costed released items any variance calculated at work order close is recorded in work in progress with the new types "Work order actual cost adjustment" and "Work order negative actual cost adjustment".

This variance is, subsequently, posted to the stock account (finance).

Note: for Standard costed released items any variance continues to be posted to the variance account (finance) via WIP types "Work order variance" and "Work order negative variance".

content_parts.content:
The Close button is now Close order to improve clarity on the Work order page, 

Additionally, the Post button is now Post stock in situations where no financial records are updated. This affects pages related to Purchasing, Sales and Stock.
